intro: Gomphostemma membranifolium, commonly known as the membranous-leaf false holly, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in a thin, membranous layer. It produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in racemes, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant is adapted to moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
